alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, east central Caroline and northwestern Essex Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bowling Green, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Newtown around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Elevon, Beazley, Sparta, Central Point, Hustle and Salvia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen
